Definition: I and another person or other people; I and youpeople in general
Example:
we've moved to atlanta.
we'd (= the company would) like to offer you the job.
why don't we go and see it together?
we should take more care of our historic buildings.

Definition: not physically strongthat cannot support a lot of weight; likely to breakeasy to influence; not having much powerpeople who are poor, sick or without powernot financially strong or successfula weak liquid contains a lot of waternot easily seen or heardnot good at somethingthat people are not likely to believe or be persuaded bydone without enthusiasm or energythe part of a person’s character, an argument, etc. that is easy to attack or criticizea weak verb forms the past tense and past participle by adding a regular ending and not by changing a vowel. In English this is done by adding -d, -ed or -t (for example walk, walked).used when there is no stress on the word. For example, the weak form of and is /ən/ or /n/, as in fish and chips /fɪʃ ən tʃɪps/.you intend to do good things but you are too lazy, weak or busy to actually do themhardly able to stand because of emotion, fear, illness, etc.the point at which a system or an organization is most likely to fail
Example:
she is still weak after her illness.
his legs felt weak.
she suffered from a weak heart.
i was exhausted and weak with hunger.

Definition: to make somebody/something less strong or powerful; to become less strong or powerfulto make something less physically strong; to become less physically strongto become or make somebody become less determined or certain about somethingto become less strongto become less strong; to make a currency or economy less strong
Example:
the team has been weakened by injury.
the new evidence weakens the case against her.
this new story has severely weakened the president’s position.
his authority is steadily weakening.

Definition: lack of physical strengthlack of power, influence or strength of charactera weak point in a system, somebody’s character, etc.how weak a country's currency is in relation to other countries' currenciesdifficulty in resisting something/somebody that you like very much
Example:
the disease causes progressive muscle weakness.
the sudden weakness in her legs made her stumble.
he thought that crying was a sign of weakness.
asking for help would be an admission of weakness.

Definition: a large amount of money, property, etc. that a person or country ownsthe state of being richa large amount of something
Example:
the desire to gain wealth and power
he has pledged to redistribute the country's vast oil wealth.
their aim is to keep taxes low enough to encourage wealth creation.
a person of wealth and influence

Definition: having a lot of money, possessions, etc.people who are rich
Example:
a wealthy businessman/individual/family
a wealthy country/nation
the deal is about to make him a very wealthy man.
the couple are said to be fabulously wealthy.

Definition: an object such as a knife, gun, bomb, etc. that is used for fighting or attacking somebodysomething such as knowledge, words, actions, etc. that can be used to attack or fight against somebody/somethingto be something that has both advantages and disadvantages
Example:
modern nuclear weapons are much more destructive than either biological or chemical weapons.
a lethal/deadly weapon
the police still haven't found the murder weapon.
police believed the men were carrying weapons.

Definition: to have something on your body as a piece of clothing, a decoration, etc.to have your hair in a particular style; to have a beard or moustacheto have a particular expression on your faceto become, or make something become thinner, smoother or weaker through continuous use or rubbingto make a hole, path, etc. in something by continuous use or rubbingto stay in good condition after being used for a long timeto accept or allow something, especially something that you do not approve ofif you feel that a remark applies to you, you should accept it and take it as a warning or criticismto allow your feelings to be seen by other peopleto begin to become weaker or less acceptableto be the person in a marriage or other relationship who makes most of the decisions
Example:
he was wearing a new suit.
to wear clothes/clothing
to wear a shirt/hat/uniform
to wear shoes/glasses

Definition: the condition of the atmosphere at a particular place and time, such as the temperature, and if there is wind, rain, sun, etc.a report of what the weather will be like, on the radio or television, in the newspapers or onlineif you say that it is brass monkeys or brass monkey weather, you mean that it is very cold weatherin all kinds of weather, good and badto watch somebody/something carefully in case you need to take actionto seem to find something more difficult or complicated than it needs to beif you are or feel under the weather, you feel slightly ill and not as well as usual
Example:
cold/hot/warm/wet/dry weather
severe/extreme weather
good/bad weather
flights have been delayed because of the inclement weather.

Definition: to make cloth, a carpet, a basket, etc. by crossing threads or narrow pieces of material across, over and under each other by hand or on a machine called a loomto make something by twisting flowers, pieces of wood, etc. togetherto move along by running and changing direction continuously to avoid things that are in your wayto put facts, events, details, etc. together to make a story or a closely connected wholeto perform or behave in a way that is attractive or interesting, or that makes somebody behave in a particular way
Example:
the baskets are woven from strips of willow.
the strips of willow are woven into baskets.
threads woven together
most spiders weave webs that are almost invisible.

Definition: a system for finding information on the internet, in which documents are connected to other documentsa fine net of thread made by a spider to catch insectsa complicated pattern of things that are closely connected to each othera piece of skin that joins the toes of some birds and animals that swim, for example ducks and frogs
Example:
to surf/browse/search the web
the service is available to anyone with access to the web.
i found the information on the web.
i did a web search to find the best price.

Definition: a set of pages on the internet, where a company or an organization, or an individual person, puts information
Example:
for current prices please visit our website.
the company has recently launched a new website.
she sent me links to several useful websites.
the festival's official website

Definition: a marriage ceremony, and the meal or party that usually follows it
Example:
i dreamed of having a big wedding, with all my family and friends.
i'm going to a wedding this weekend.
have you been invited to their wedding?
television coverage of the royal wedding

Definition: the day of the week after Tuesday and before Thursday
Example:

are you busy next wednesday?
wednesday morning/afternoon/evening

Definition: a wild plant growing where it is not wanted, especially among crops or garden plantsany wild plant without flowers that grows in water and forms a green floating masstobacco or cigarettesthe drug cannabisa person with a weak character or bodywith more problems, work or commitments than you can managetoo concerned with the details of something
Example:

routine maintenance of the garden consists of keeping weeds under control.
there were weeds pushing up through the gravel.
i wish i could give up the weed (= stop smoking).

Definition: a period of seven days, either from Monday to Sunday or from Sunday to Saturdayany period of seven daysthe five days other than Saturday and Sundaythe part of the week when you go to workrecentlyseven days after the day that you mentioncontinuously for many weeksas the weeks passhappening every weekseven days after the day that you mentionseven days before the day that you mention
Example:
last/this/next week
they won by two goals the previous week.

it rained all week.

Definition: Saturday and SundaySaturday and Sunday, or a slightly longer period, as a holiday
Example:
this/next/last weekend
the office is closed at the weekend.
the office is closed on the weekend.
it happened on the weekend of 24 and 25 april.

Definition: happening, done or published once a week or every week
Example:
weekly meetings
a weekly magazine

Definition: to have a particular weightto measure how heavy somebody/something is, usually by using scalesto consider something carefully before making a decisionto have an influence on somebody’s opinion or the result of somethingto lift an anchor out of the water and into a boat before sailing awayto choose your words carefully so that you say exactly what you mean
Example:
how much do you weigh (= how heavy are you)?
she weighs 60 kilos.
a healthy baby usually weighs 6 lbs or more.
the average male tiger weighs around 200 kg.

Definition: how heavy somebody/something is, which can be measured in, for example, kilograms or poundsthe fact of being heavyan object that is heavyan object used to keep something in position or as part of a machinea great responsibility or worryimportance, influence or strengtha unit or system of units by which weight is measureda piece of metal that is known to weigh a particular amount and is used to measure the weight of something, or lifted by people to improve their strength and as a sportto have influence with somebodyused to say that there is too much of somethingto work as hard as everyone else in a job, an activity, etc.to be or try to be more successful than others in doing something that normally requires more skill, experience, money, etc. than you haveto sit down and rest, especially when you are tiredto use your position of authority or power in an aggressive way in order to achieve what you wantto use all your influence and power to support somethingthe combined power, strength or influence of a groupvery useful or valuable
Example:
it is about 76 kilos in weight.
bananas are sold by weight.
in the wild, this fish can reach a weight of 5lbs.
she is trying to lose weight (= become less heavy and less fat).

Definition: very strange or unusual and difficult to explainstrange in a mysterious and frightening wayused to show that ‘funny’ is being used with the meaning of ‘strange’
Example:

Definition: the total amount of crops, profits, etc. that are produced
Example:
a high crop yield
a reduction in milk yield
this will give a yield of 10% on your investment.

Definition: the total amount of crops, profits, etc. that are produced
Example:
a high crop yield
a reduction in milk yield
this will give a yield of 10% on your investment.

Definition: used as the subject or object of a verb or after a preposition to refer to the person or people being spoken or written toused with nouns and adjectives to speak to somebody directlyused for referring to people in generalyou, your family and your close friends
Example:
you said you knew the way.
i thought she told you.
can i sit next to you?
i want both of you to help.

Definition: having lived or existed for only a short time; not fully developednot yet old; not as old as othersconsisting of young people or young children; with a low average agesuitable or appropriate for young peopleused to show that you are angry or annoyed with a particular young personused before or after a person’s name to show the difference between them and an older relativeused to say that people seem to be doing something at a younger age than they used to, or that they seem younger because you are now olderused when you are commenting that time is passing and that you are growing olderused to describe a young person who acts in a more sensible way than you would expect for a person of their agethinking and behaving like a young person even when you are oldyoung people should enjoy themselves as much as possible, because they will have to work and worry later in their lives
Example:
young babies need to be wrapped up warmly.
a young country
caterpillars eat the young leaves of this plant.
it's a young wine, not really up to drinking yet.

Definition: having lived or existed for only a short time; not fully developednot yet old; not as old as othersconsisting of young people or young children; with a low average agesuitable or appropriate for young peopleused to show that you are angry or annoyed with a particular young personused before or after a person’s name to show the difference between them and an older relativeused to say that people seem to be doing something at a younger age than they used to, or that they seem younger because you are now olderused when you are commenting that time is passing and that you are growing olderused to describe a young person who acts in a more sensible way than you would expect for a person of their agethinking and behaving like a young person even when you are oldyoung people should enjoy themselves as much as possible, because they will have to work and worry later in their lives
Example:
young babies need to be wrapped up warmly.
a young country

Definition: a young person or a child
Example: the camp is for youngsters aged 8 to 14.

Definition: of or belonging to the person or people being spoken or written toof or belonging to people in generalused to show that somebody/something is well known or often talked aboutused in some titles, especially those of royal people
Example:
i like your dress.
excuse me, is this your seat?
the bank is on your right.
dentists advise you to have your teeth checked every six months.

Definition: of or belonging to youused at the end of a letter before signing your nameyour homeyou, your family and your close friends
Example:
is that book yours?
is she a friend of yours?
my hair is very fine. yours is much thicker.
yours sincerely/faithfully

Definition: used when the person or people being spoken to both cause and are affected by an actionused to emphasize the fact that the person who is being spoken to is doing somethingused instead of ‘you’ in order to sound polite or formal (although some people do not consider this use to be correct)to act naturallyalone; without anyone elsewithout helpfor only you to have or use; not shared
Example:
have you hurt yourself?
you don't seem quite yourself today (= you do not seem well or do not seem as happy as usual).
enjoy yourselves!
do it yourself—i don't have time.

Definition: the time of life when a person is young, especially the time before a child becomes an adultthe quality or state of being youngyoung people considered as a groupa young man
Example:
he had been a talented musician in his youth.
she regrets that she spent her youth travelling and not studying.
to relive/recapture your youth
he joked that being good at cards was the sign of a misspent youth (= having wasted his time when he was young).

Definition: 0a temperature, pressure, etc. that is equal to zero on a scalethe lowest possible amount or level; nothing at all
Example:
five, four, three, two, one, zero… we have lift-off.
it was ten degrees below zero last night (= −10°c).
the thermometer had fallen to zero.
i rated my chances as zero.

Definition: an area or a region with a particular feature or useone of the areas that a larger area is divided into for the purpose of organizationan area or a part of an object, especially one that is different from everything that is around itone of the parts that the earth’s surface is divided into by imaginary lines that are parallel to the equatorin a state in which you feel confident and are performing at your besta state in which things are strange, mysterious or secret; a state that exists on the dividing line between two things
Example:
a war/combat/demilitarized/exclusion zone
a danger zone
a pedestrian zone (= where vehicles may not go)
they have called for a 100-mile buffer zone (= protected area) around the island to protect the seals.
